entry.content:
Description

tox is a widely-used tool for automating testing in Python. In this talk, we will go behind the scenes of the creation of tox 4, the latest version of the tool. We will discuss the motivations for the rewrite, the challenges and lessons learned during the development process. We will have a look at the new features and improvements introduced in tox 4. But most importantly, you will get to know the maintainers.

entry.content:
Description

Imagine you created this awesome Python project.

But before you want to release it to the world, you want to make sure it follows the Python coding standards.

You have heard of Flake8, but you are unsure whether you should install it system-wide, run it in your IDE or in even in CI?

How and where should you configure Flake8?

How do you make sure your colleagues also use the same linters... in the same version?

entry.title: What Is a Reasonable Percentage for Code Coverage and Why Is It 100%?
entry.content:
Description

Have you ever thought about how much code coverage is good enough?

Is 60% good or good enough? 80% is great, right?

But what about 100%? Impossible? Too hard to reach? Not worth the effort?

Join me in finding the right number.
